tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: I recently visited Smilessence center for a dental check-up, and I was thoroughly impressed with the experience. The office was clean and modern, and the staff were friendly and welcoming from the moment I walked in. Dr. Shantanu jambhekar and Dr. Sonia jambhekar  they both are Incredibly knowledgeable and took the time to explain everything clearly during the examination. Dr. Shantanu Jambhekar He was gentle and made sure I was comfortable throughout the entire process. I appreciated Dr. Sonia Jambhekar how she addressed all my questions and concerns with patience and professionalism. Overall, I had a fantastic experience and would highly recommend Smilessence center to anyone looking for top-notch dental care.

review: Extremely warm & hospitable. Eye for detail and recommends right treatment incase of surgical/non-surgical procedure. My root cause of a pain was detected by him within a second, wherein I was supposed to get operated today for a tooth infection on my 6th molar by a different doctor. When Dr Shantanu Diagnosed me with his modern hi-tech clinical equipment which we hardly see in an area like Parel. firstly I was quiet happy and content. He shown me that I was having a problem on my root canal which was done by an earlier Doc..So I am going to do a re-root canal from him..It is an absolute privilege to have him at Parel.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review: The doctor recommended me an expensive CT Scan procedure which raised my concern. I consulted three other dentists and all three informed there was no need for it in my case. I could not trust him anymore so went to another dentist. In the meantime, ***** ** ****** ******** ****** ** ** **** ***** ********* I had to get a full cleaning done again at the new dentist.
reply_text: Dear patient We at Smilessence ensure that every patient gets the best treatment experience one can get across the board.You reported to us with already RCTed teeth that were symptomatic,& that called for further specialist care. We had our able experienced endodontist(specialist in re-root canal treatments) handle your case. I believe the treatment progressed smoothly and our specialist was able to negotiate the previously untreated part left by your previous dentist as planned.We were suspicious of additional root canal bring present due to the anatomy of additional root as seen on the xrays.Hence, we suggested(not mandated you)to have a CBCT for one of the involved tooth just to be 100%sure that no canals are left untreated before we complete the treatment.CBCT scans allow 3 D visualization of the tooth anatomy and allow the clinician to locate any anomalous canals virtually on computer screen.This not only enhances the quality of work,conserves tooth structure in finding the canals but also to ensure that you have no issues going further.Root canal is two part process-cleaning and shaping followed by filling the canal with inert material.Systems used by different dentist would vary.Thus requiring the other dentist to reshape the canals according to the system he uses.(we would have to the same if any patient comes to us ) We did try to contact you multiple occasion to understand the concern and reassure you but you never got back after completing your 1st appointment.Its unfortunate that you think we did not meet your expectations.We stand by our specialist and his opinion.I am also sure the current dentist would be happy as our specialist has made his life easy completing the actual difficult part of root canal of negotiating till the optimal length of the canal.
